anchor-for-dummies.anchor-101: Learn Anchor framework basics: set up your first Solana program, understand macros and account validation, and master the essential building blocks.
anchor-for-dummies.anchor-accounts: Master Anchor account types and validation. Learn PDAs, discriminators, token accounts, remaining accounts, and advanced constraint patterns for secure programs.
anchor-for-dummies.anchor-instructions: Build robust Anchor instructions with proper context, CPIs, and error handling. Learn instruction structure, parameters, and cross-program invocation patterns.
anchor-for-dummies.advanced-anchor: Unlock advanced Anchor techniques: feature flags, zero-copy accounts, raw CPIs, and working with large accounts beyond standard limitations.
anchor-for-dummies.client-side-development: Connect your Anchor program to TypeScript clients. Learn the Anchor SDK, fetch accounts, emit events, and build full-stack Solana applications.
anchor-for-dummies.program-deployment: Deploy and upgrade Anchor programs to devnet and mainnet. Master deployment strategies, verified builds, IDL management, and program migration.
anchor-for-dummies.testing-your-program: Test Anchor programs with TypeScript, Mollusk, and LiteSVM. Set up local validators, clone mainnet accounts, and use Surfnet for complex CPIs.
anchor-for-dummies.conclusion: Complete your Anchor journey with next steps, challenge exercises, and resources to continue building secure Solana programs from scratch.

create-your-sdk-with-codama.introduction: Discover Codama: generate type-safe clients for Solana programs across multiple languages. Learn nodes, visitors, renderers, and the Codama IDL architecture.
create-your-sdk-with-codama.codama-from-scratch: Build Codama IDLs from scratch using nodes. Learn value nodes, type nodes, discriminators, PDAs, accounts, instructions, and error definitions.
create-your-sdk-with-codama.codama-with-anchor: Convert Anchor IDLs to Codama with rootNodeFromAnchor. Bridge Anchor programs to multi-language SDK generation in seconds.
create-your-sdk-with-codama.updating-codama-idl: Transform Codama IDLs with visitors. Add PDAs, update accounts, enhance instructions, and customize types for production-ready SDKs.
create-your-sdk-with-codama.conclusion: Wrap up your Codama learning with best practices, advanced patterns, and next steps for building powerful multi-language Solana SDKs.

instruction-introspection.introduction: Understand instruction introspection on Solana. Learn the Instructions sysvar, transaction analysis, and building composable cross-program safeguards.
instruction-introspection.introspection-with-anchor: Implement instruction introspection in Anchor programs. Validate transaction instructions, enforce constraints, and build secure composable protocols.
instruction-introspection.introspection-with-pinocchio: Add instruction introspection to Pinocchio programs. Parse Instructions sysvar, verify cross-program calls, and enforce transaction-level security.
instruction-introspection.conclusion: Master instruction introspection patterns, common pitfalls, security best practices, and real-world use cases for composable Solana programs.

introduction-to-assembly.assembly-101: Learn Solana assembly basics: understand SBPF architecture, registers, memory layout, and how Solana programs execute at the lowest level.
introduction-to-assembly.registers-and-memory: Master SBPF registers and memory management. Learn stack, heap, frame pointers, and how Solana allocates memory during program execution.
introduction-to-assembly.instructions: Decode SBPF instruction set: arithmetic, logic, memory operations, control flow, and the opcodes that power Solana program execution.
introduction-to-assembly.tooling: Set up assembly development tools for Solana: compilers, debuggers, disassemblers, and techniques for inspecting compiled program bytecode.
introduction-to-assembly.program-example: Build a complete assembly program from scratch. See real SBPF code in action with a working example that demonstrates core assembly patterns.
introduction-to-assembly.conclusion: Finish your assembly journey with optimization techniques, debugging strategies, and resources for advanced low-level Solana development.

introduction-to-blockchain-and-solana.introduction: Start your blockchain journey: understand distributed ledgers, consensus mechanisms, and why blockchain technology matters for the future of finance.
introduction-to-blockchain-and-solana.blockchain-fundamentals: Learn blockchain core concepts: blocks, transactions, hashing, Merkle trees, consensus algorithms, and the technology behind decentralized networks.
introduction-to-blockchain-and-solana.blockchain-evolution: Trace blockchain history from Bitcoin to Ethereum to Solana. See how each generation solved scalability, speed, and cost challenges.
introduction-to-blockchain-and-solana.introduction-to-solana: Discover what makes Solana unique: Proof of History, parallel processing, 400ms blocks, and the architecture enabling thousands of TPS.
introduction-to-blockchain-and-solana.conclusion: Complete your blockchain foundation with Solana's competitive advantages, ecosystem overview, and your next steps in Web3 development.

introduction-to-low-level-solana.low-level-101: Understand low-level Solana program structure. Learn account models, program ownership, instruction processing, and native development fundamentals.
introduction-to-low-level-solana.entrypoint: Master Solana program entrypoints: deserialize accounts and instruction data, validate inputs, and dispatch instructions without framework abstractions.

nfts-on-solana.introduction: Learn NFT fundamentals on Solana: what makes NFTs unique, their use cases, and why Solana's speed makes it ideal for digital collectibles.
nfts-on-solana.metaplex-core: Create NFTs with Metaplex Core: the modern standard for Solana NFTs with lower costs, better performance, and simplified asset management.
nfts-on-solana.metaplex-token-metadata: Build NFTs using Token Metadata: the original Metaplex standard with rich metadata, collections, and creator royalties for digital assets.
nfts-on-solana.conclusion: Master NFT creation on Solana with best practices, comparison of standards, marketplace integration, and next steps for building NFT projects.

pinocchio-for-dummies.pinocchio-101: Start native Solana development with Pinocchio: zero-copy operations, manual account validation, and building programs without heavy frameworks.
pinocchio-for-dummies.pinocchio-accounts: Handle accounts in Pinocchio: parse raw account data, implement zero-copy patterns, and validate account ownership manually.
pinocchio-for-dummies.pinocchio-instructions: Build Pinocchio instructions: create discriminators, deserialize instruction data, and implement TryFrom patterns for type-safe validation.
pinocchio-for-dummies.pinocchio-errors: Implement error handling in Pinocchio: define custom errors, return meaningful messages, and handle failure cases without macro abstractions.
pinocchio-for-dummies.reading-and-writing-data: Master data operations in Pinocchio: read and write account data with zero-copy techniques, avoid unnecessary allocations, and optimize memory usage.
pinocchio-for-dummies.testing-your-program: Test Pinocchio programs with Rust and TypeScript. Set up test environments, validate business logic, and ensure correctness before deployment.
pinocchio-for-dummies.batch-instructions: Optimize Pinocchio programs with batch instructions: process multiple operations efficiently, reduce transaction costs, and improve program throughput.
pinocchio-for-dummies.middleware-entrypoint: Build middleware entrypoints in Pinocchio: intercept instructions, add custom validation layers, and compose complex program behaviors.
pinocchio-for-dummies.performance: Optimize Pinocchio program performance: reduce compute units, minimize memory usage, and achieve maximum efficiency in native Solana development.
pinocchio-for-dummies.conclusion: Complete your Pinocchio journey with advanced patterns, security considerations, and next steps for expert-level native Solana programming.

program-security.introduction: Understand Solana security fundamentals: account ownership, validation requirements, and common vulnerability patterns that threaten program safety.
program-security.signer-checks: Prevent unauthorized access with signer checks. Learn why signature verification matters and how missing checks lead to account takeovers.
program-security.owner-checks: Validate account ownership to prevent spoofing attacks. Understand why owner checks are critical when reading account data across programs.
program-security.data-matching: Validate account data integrity: ensure fields match expected values, prevent data manipulation, and build robust validation logic in instructions.
program-security.type-cosplay: Defend against type cosplay attacks where malicious accounts impersonate legitimate types. Learn account type validation and discriminator checks.
program-security.arbitrary-cpi: Secure cross-program invocations: validate target programs, verify account relationships, and prevent attackers from injecting malicious CPIs.
program-security.duplicate-mutable-accounts: Handle duplicate account attacks: detect when the same account appears multiple times and prevent double-spending or state corruption.
program-security.pda-sharing: Secure PDAs from collision attacks: implement unique seeds, avoid predictable derivations, and prevent unauthorized access to program-derived accounts.
program-security.reinitialization-attacks: Prevent account reinitialization exploits: check initialization state, use discriminators properly, and avoid resetting critical account data.
program-security.revival-attacks: Defend against account revival attacks where closed accounts are reopened maliciously. Implement proper account closure and validation patterns.
program-security.conclusion: Master Solana security with a comprehensive checklist, audit strategies, and resources for building production-grade secure programs.

quantum-vault.introduction-to-quantum-vault: Build Quantum Vault: a complete Solana program showcasing accounts, instructions, PDAs, and security patterns in a real-world vault application.

research-crateless-program.lesson: Build Solana programs without external crates: minimize dependencies, reduce binary size, and achieve ultimate control with crateless development patterns.

secp256r1-on-solana.introduction: Discover secp256r1 on Solana: enable WebAuthn, passkey authentication, and integrate with existing elliptic curve systems using secp256r1 signatures.
secp256r1-on-solana.secp256r1-with-anchor: Implement secp256r1 in Anchor programs: verify signatures, integrate WebAuthn, and build passwordless authentication with the secp256r1 syscall.
secp256r1-on-solana.secp256r1-with-pinocchio: Add secp256r1 to Pinocchio programs: use native syscalls for signature verification and build lightweight passkey authentication without frameworks.
secp256r1-on-solana.conclusion: Complete your secp256r1 journey with security considerations, best practices, and next steps for WebAuthn integration in Solana applications.

solana-pay.introduction: Learn Solana Pay basics: understand payment requests, QR codes, and how to accept instant, low-cost payments on Solana without intermediaries.
solana-pay.transfer-request: Implement Solana Pay transfer requests: generate payment links, specify recipients and amounts, and accept direct SOL or token transfers via QR codes.
solana-pay.transaction-request: Build transaction requests with Solana Pay: trigger custom program instructions, combine payments with actions, and create rich payment experiences.
solana-pay.conclusion: Master Solana Pay integration with production tips, mobile wallet compatibility, and strategies for accepting payments in real-world applications.

spl-token-with-anchor.introduction: Master SPL Token Program with Anchor: create tokens, manage mints, and build token operations using Anchor's convenient CPI helpers.
spl-token-with-anchor.mint-to: Mint new tokens with Anchor: create token supply, distribute to token accounts, and manage mint authority using SPL Token CPIs.
spl-token-with-anchor.transfer: Transfer SPL tokens in Anchor programs: move tokens between accounts, validate balances, and implement secure token transfer logic.
spl-token-with-anchor.burn: Burn tokens to reduce supply: permanently remove tokens from circulation using Anchor CPI helpers and proper authority checks.
spl-token-with-anchor.approve-and-revoke: Manage token delegates in Anchor: approve spending limits, delegate authority, and revoke permissions with SPL Token instructions.
spl-token-with-anchor.freeze-and-thaw: Freeze and thaw token accounts: temporarily lock token transfers using freeze authority and restore access when needed.
spl-token-with-anchor.set-authority: Update token authorities in Anchor: transfer mint authority, freeze authority, and implement secure authority management patterns.
spl-token-with-anchor.close-account: Close token accounts to recover rent: properly close empty token accounts, reclaim lamports, and clean up unused account state.
spl-token-with-anchor.conclusion: Complete your SPL Token journey with best practices, security patterns, and advanced token program integration strategies for production apps.

spl-token-with-web3js.introduction: Use SPL Token Program with web3.js: interact with tokens from JavaScript, build token operations, and integrate tokens into web applications.
spl-token-with-web3js.mint-to: Mint tokens using web3.js: create token supply, send to token accounts, and manage minting operations from TypeScript clients.
spl-token-with-web3js.transfer: Transfer SPL tokens with web3.js: send tokens between accounts, validate balances, and build token transfer functionality in web apps.
spl-token-with-web3js.burn: Burn tokens from JavaScript: reduce token supply permanently using web3.js and proper burn instruction construction.
spl-token-with-web3js.approve-and-revoke: Manage delegates with web3.js: set spending allowances, grant token permissions, and revoke delegated access from TypeScript.
spl-token-with-web3js.freeze-and-thaw: Control token account freezing from web3.js: lock and unlock token transfers using freeze authority and JavaScript clients.
spl-token-with-web3js.set-authority: Change token authorities in web3.js: update mint and freeze authorities programmatically from TypeScript applications.
spl-token-with-web3js.close-account: Close token accounts with web3.js: reclaim rent by closing empty accounts and cleaning up token account state from clients.
spl-token-with-web3js.conclusion: Master SPL Token integration in web applications with client-side best practices, error handling, and production-ready token patterns.

testing-with-litesvm.litesvm-101: Discover LiteSVM: ultra-fast Solana testing with embedded VM, account manipulation, and instant test execution without validator overhead.
testing-with-litesvm.rust: Test Solana programs in Rust with LiteSVM: write unit tests, manipulate accounts, and validate program logic at blazing speed.
testing-with-litesvm.typescript: Test from TypeScript using LiteSVM: run fast integration tests, validate client interactions, and test Anchor programs with anchor-litesvm.
testing-with-litesvm.conclusion: Master LiteSVM testing with advanced techniques, performance optimization, debugging strategies, and best practices for comprehensive test coverage.

testing-with-mollusk.mollusk-101: Learn Mollusk testing for Solana: write Rust-native tests, set up complex account states, and validate program logic without network overhead.
testing-with-mollusk.advanced-functionalities: Unlock Mollusk advanced features: simulate sysvars, test CPIs in isolation, mock program accounts, and create sophisticated test scenarios.
testing-with-mollusk.conclusion: Complete your Mollusk journey with test organization patterns, debugging techniques, and strategies for comprehensive program test coverage.

testing-with-surfpool.surfpool-101: Start with Surfnet and Surfpool: fetch mainnet accounts on-demand, test complex CPIs, and simulate production environments locally.
testing-with-surfpool.advanced-functionalities: Master Surfpool advanced features: cache strategies, account overrides, custom RPC endpoints, and optimization for faster test execution.
testing-with-surfpool.conclusion: Finish your Surfpool learning with production testing patterns, CI/CD integration, and strategies for realistic mainnet simulation.

token-2022-program.introduction: Discover Token Extensions (Token-2022): the next-generation token standard with built-in compliance, transfer fees, metadata, and advanced features.
token-2022-program.token-extensions: Explore all Token-2022 extensions: transfer fees, confidential transfers, metadata, interest-bearing tokens, and choosing the right extensions.
token-2022-program.conclusion: Master Token-2022 with migration strategies from SPL Token, compatibility considerations, and building next-gen token applications.

token-2022-with-anchor.introduction: Use Token-2022 in Anchor programs: work with token extensions, handle interface accounts, and build modern token functionality in Anchor.
token-2022-with-anchor.transfer-fee-extension: Implement transfer fees with Token-2022 in Anchor: charge fees on transfers, collect revenue, and manage fee accounts in programs.
token-2022-with-anchor.metadata-extension: Add onchain metadata with Token-2022: store token names, symbols, and URIs directly in mint accounts using Anchor helpers.
token-2022-with-anchor.mint-close-authority-extension: Enable mint closing with Token-2022: recover rent from mint accounts after token lifecycle ends using Anchor extensions.
token-2022-with-anchor.interest-bearing-extension: Create interest-bearing tokens in Anchor: automatically accrue interest, calculate yields, and build DeFi primitives with Token-2022.
token-2022-with-anchor.permanent-delegate-extension: Implement permanent delegates with Token-2022: grant irrevocable transfer authority for compliance and specialized token use cases.
token-2022-with-anchor.non-transferable-extension: Build non-transferable tokens in Anchor: create soulbound tokens, credentials, and locked assets using Token-2022 extensions.
token-2022-with-anchor.default-account-state-extension: Set default account states with Token-2022: automatically freeze new token accounts for compliance and controlled distribution.
token-2022-with-anchor.cpi-guard-extension: Add CPI protection to tokens: prevent unauthorized CPI access, protect users from malicious programs, and enhance token security.
token-2022-with-anchor.memo-transfer-extension: Require transfer memos with Token-2022: enforce transaction documentation, comply with regulations, and track token movement reasons.
token-2022-with-anchor.immutable-owner-extension: Lock token account ownership: prevent owner changes, create secure token accounts, and eliminate ownership manipulation risks.
token-2022-with-anchor.group-and-member-extension: Build token groups and members: create token families, manage collections, and implement hierarchical token structures in Anchor.
token-2022-with-anchor.conclusion: Master Token-2022 in Anchor with extension combinations, migration patterns, and building production token programs with advanced features.

token-2022-with-web3js.introduction: Integrate Token-2022 in web apps: use token extensions from JavaScript, handle extension accounts, and build modern token UIs.
token-2022-with-web3js.transfer-fee-extension: Handle transfer fees in web3.js: calculate fees, display costs to users, and implement fee-aware token transfers in applications.
token-2022-with-web3js.metadata-extension: Read token metadata with web3.js: fetch names, symbols, URIs from Token-2022 mints and display rich token information.
token-2022-with-web3js.mint-close-authority-extension: Close mints from TypeScript: recover rent from exhausted tokens and handle mint lifecycle in web applications.
token-2022-with-web3js.interest-bearing-extension: Display interest-bearing tokens: calculate accrued interest, show APY to users, and build DeFi interfaces with Token-2022.
token-2022-with-web3js.permanent-delegate-extension: Work with permanent delegates in web3.js: check delegation status, validate permissions, and integrate compliant tokens.
token-2022-with-web3js.non-transferable-extension: Handle non-transferable tokens from JavaScript: validate transfer restrictions and build UIs for soulbound tokens.
token-2022-with-web3js.default-account-state-extension: Manage frozen accounts with web3.js: check freeze status, request thaws, and handle compliance workflows in applications.
token-2022-with-web3js.cpi-guard-extension: Implement CPI guard in web apps: check protection status, educate users about security features, and validate token operations.
token-2022-with-web3js.memo-transfer-extension: Add transfer memos in JavaScript: prompt users for transaction notes, comply with regulations, and track payment purposes.
token-2022-with-web3js.immutable-owner-extension: Verify immutable ownership from web3.js: validate account security, display protection status, and build safer token interfaces.
token-2022-with-web3js.group-and-member-extension: Display token groups in web apps: show token families, visualize relationships, and build collection browsers with Token-2022.
token-2022-with-web3js.conclusion: Build production Token-2022 applications with client-side patterns, user experience best practices, and comprehensive extension handling.

tokens-on-solana.introduction: Understand tokens on Solana: learn token fundamentals, why they matter, and how Solana's account model differs from Ethereum and Bitcoin.
tokens-on-solana.mint-and-token-accounts: Master mint and token accounts: understand the SPL Token Program architecture, associated token accounts, and account relationships.
tokens-on-solana.functionalities: Explore SPL Token Program features: minting, transferring, burning, delegating, freezing, and all operations available for Solana tokens.
tokens-on-solana.metaplex-token-metadata: Add metadata to fungible tokens: use Metaplex Token Metadata for rich token information, logos, and integration with wallets.
tokens-on-solana.conclusion: Complete your token journey with best practices, Token-2022 overview, and next steps for building token-powered Solana applications.

winternitz-signatures-on-solana.introduction: Learn Winternitz signatures on Solana: post-quantum cryptography, hash-based signatures, and preparing for quantum-resistant blockchain security.
winternitz-signatures-on-solana.winternitz-signatures-with-anchor: Implement Winternitz signatures in Anchor: verify hash-based signatures, build quantum-resistant programs, and future-proof your applications.
winternitz-signatures-on-solana.winternitz-signatures-with-pinocchio: Add Winternitz to Pinocchio programs: native hash-based signature verification, quantum resistance without frameworks.
winternitz-signatures-on-solana.conclusion: Master post-quantum cryptography on Solana with security analysis, performance considerations, and strategies for quantum-resistant blockchain development.
